column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////As for the food- WOW. We routinely share when we eat so
column3: I let the boy take the lead on the ordering. Not everything was what I would have ordered but I was still very impressed. The shrimp de jonghe is not to be missed. I was loving the bread and butter service but when that garlicky shrimp showed up
column4: all bets were off. We also had the smoked salmon Caesar (fine but we agreed it was the weakest thing we ordered)
column7: elote corn and the 22 oz ribeye with bone marrow accompaniment. We made a dent in everything but left with a bag of leftovers including half a steak. The bernaise sauce and steak salt served alongside the ribeye really elevated it to the next level.
